comments.author: dbshck
comments.body: We can't tell you if it's going to be a good decision, so you need to have your own conviction. What makes you want to buy and hold it for long term?To provide some perspective, I can share my personal views on Solana. I'm a fan of the chain and use it regularly, particularly for NFT-DeFi applications. Right now I enjoyed lending SOL against NFTs on platforms like sharky.fi and FFF's Citrus to make some passive investments. While its native DeFi space may not be as big as it was during the FTX era (guess all that TVL come from Alameda ), the NFT ecosystem remains active and thriving. Solana's high TPS and low fees are key unique points that differentiate it from other chains like Ethereum and its L2 solutions. If the dev and foundation continue to improve the chain (no more downtime) and step up their BD/marketing game, it could potentially work well for Solana's long-term prospects.

comments.body: Buying Solana (SOL) and keeping it for the long term can be a good investment strategy if you have confidence in the potential of the project and its ability to solve real-world problems. SOL is a cryptocurrency that aims to provide a fast, secure, and scalable blockchain infrastructure that can support a wide range of decentralized applications and I guess this too Keep in mind that the crypto market is very volatile, and SOL prices can fluctuate significantly in a short period of time. So it is important to have a long term investment horizon and a strong risk management strategy.
